greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array read by rows. T(n,k) is the number of chain topologies on an n-set with exactly k open sets where one of the open sets is a single point set, n>=2, 3<=k<=n+1.
comment: A chain topology is a topology that can be totally ordered by inclusion.
formula: E.g.f.: y^2*x/(1 - y*(exp(x) - 1)). Generally for chain topologies where the smallest nonempty open set has size m: x^m/m! * y^2/(1 - y*(exp(x) - 1)).
mathematica: nn = 10; Map[Select[#, # > 0 &] &, Drop[Range[0, nn]! CoefficientList[Series[   x/(1 - y (Exp[x] - 1)), {x, 0, nn}], {x, y}], 2]] // Grid
xref: Cf. A268216 where the topologies are further restricted.
results.author: _Geoffrey Critzer_, Feb 16 2017
